snippet: The Obama administration on Wednesday urged a federal appeals court to overturn a ruling that blocked enforcement of a statute related to the indefinite detention without trial of terrorism suspects.
abstract: Obama administration urges Court of Appeals for Second Circuit in Manhattan to overturn sweeping ruling by district judge that blocked government from enforcing statute related to indefinite detention without trial of terrorism suspects.

byline.contributor: Charlie Savage contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Wednesday urged a federal appeals court to overturn a ruling that blocked enforcement of a statute related to the indefinite detention without trial of terrorism suspects.

headline.main: Court Urged to Reverse a Ruling on Terror
headline.print_headline: Court Urged To Reverse A Ruling On Terror
